Prospera International Network of Women's Funds To provide core support to Prospera International Network of Women's Funds, enabling it to continue strengthening the work of women's funds. As the global hub of women's funds, Prospera seeks to create opportunities for greater collaboration among its members and across sectors, develop technical skills and knowledge, and mobilise resources to strengthen and support women's funds to realise women's rights. 600'000.00 Worldwide Issues Affecting Women 2016 36 months (1 Nov 2016-31.10.2019)
Protection International To build a safer environment for human rights defenders in Asia, Africa and Latin America by enhancing their security strategies where they are most at risk. PI implements comprehensive protection programmes, tailored to specific contexts, encompassing complementary strategies of capacity building, advocacy, research, publications and media tools. PI seeks to empower local defenders, increasing their capacity to manage their protection and security. 714'286.00 Worldwide International Human Rights Supporting and protecting human rights defenders 2018 36 months (1 Jun 2018-1 Jun 2021)

Sportsklubbernes Venner The purpose is to re-establish a ski lift in Qaqortoq in the southern part of Greenland. The project is a result of the energy that was created with the Murmal project which was supported by Oak Foundation Denmark. The ski lift can bring people in the town together both in establishing it and later as a social meeting place for all generations. 46'178.00 Greenland Oak Foundation Denmark 2018 12 months (15 Nov 2018-15 Nov 2019)
St Anns Redevelopment Trust (StART) To enable StART to continue its work to develop community-led housing at the St Anns Hospital site in Haringey, North London. StART was established by a group of local residents and workers who want to put local people in control by: developing affordable homes; promoting health and wellbeing; and creating a “green neighbourhood". 99'467.00 United Kingdom Housing and Homelessness Increasing the supply of low-income housing 2018 11 months (1 Apr 2018-31 Mar 2019)
St Katharine's the Danish Church in London To support the renovation of the Danish Church in London, which is the only Danish church in London. For many Danes it is also a meeting place away from home where they participate in social, cultural and religious events. The Church is also used for Danish language classes for Danish children and adults. 1'000'000.00 United Kingdom Special Interest 2016 36 months (1 Dec 2016-30.11.2019)
Statens Serum Institut To support research at the Statens Serum Institutin Denmark. This grant aims to prevent and treat pregnancy complications and childhood diseases by investigating environmental and genetic influences on health during pregnancy and early childhood. The Statens Serum Institut is a government institution under the Danish Ministry of Health. It is one of Denmarks largest research institutions and is responsible for the Danish preparedness against infectious diseases, biological threats and control congenital disorders. 1'556'807.00 Denmark Special Interest 2018 47 months (1 Sep 2018-31 Aug 2022)
Stop it Now! To provide core support to Stop It Now! to prevent the sexual abuse of children by mobilising adults, families and communities in the United States to take actions that protect children before they are harmed. Stop it Now! provides online and print resources, tools and programme strategies that help parents, professionals and community leaders create safe, nurturing environments for children. 500'000.00 Worldwide Prevent Child Sexual Abuse Engaging men and boys in ending sexual abuse 2016 60 months (1 Jul 2016-30 Jun 2021)
Student U To provide a full continuum of services for economically disadvantaged students in Durham Public Schools in North Carolina - beginning in sixth grade - to successfully graduate from high school and college. 1'000'000.00 United States Special Interest 2015 59 months (1 Jan 2016-31 Dec 2020)
Supportive Housing Network of New York To provide core support to the Supportive Housing Network of New York, a membership organisation representing over 200 supportive housing providers across New York State. Together they provide more than 50,000 units of supportive housing. 1'000'000.00 United States Housing and Homelessness Increasing the supply of low-income housing 2016 48 months (1 Jul 2017-30.06.2021)
Supportive Housing Network of New York To reduce the time taken to develop supportive housing; and reduce costs, by conducting data-driven analyses of systemic barriers to the development of supportive housing; and taking action to reduce them. In addition, SHNNY will work to reduce the impact of community opposition and advocate for increased funding for supportive housing. It will develop replicable tools that can be adopted across New York and other states. 311'623.00 United States Housing and Homelessness Increasing the supply of low-income housing 2009 37 months (1 Jan 2010-31 Dec 2012)
Surviving Economic Abuse To enable Surviving Economic Abuse (SEA), based in the UK, to expand its work of raising awareness about economic abuse. The outcome of SEA`s work will ensure that the general public have an understanding of economic abuse and service providers are able to help victims and survivors. SEAs vision is a world in which women and girls achieve economic equality and are able to live their lives free of abuse and exploitation. 70'000.00 United Kingdom Issues Affecting Women 2018 8 months (2 Apr 2018-31 Dec 2018)
Swiss Philanthropy Foundation To provide core support to Partners for a New Economy (P4NE), an international donors collaborative fund supported by the Swiss Philanthropy Foundation.P4NE works to generate and employ new partnerships and systems-level interventions to transform how our environment and economy are valued. 2'020'000.00 Worldwide Special Interest 2018 36 months (1 Dec 2018-31 Dec 2021)
Swisscleantech To provide core support to Swisscleantech to conduct business advocacy in Switzerland focused on sustainable development. Through this grant, Swisscleantech will become a broadly supported organisation and a strong voice for the sustainable economy in Switzerland. 2'161'616.00 Switzerland Special Interest 2016 44 months (1 Aug 2016-31.03.2020)
SydhavnsCompagniet, Settlementet i Kgs. Enghave Support to establish Sydhavnen Resource hus: A new and including user and volunteer house. The effort will strengthen the opportunities of the target group and ensure continuous personal wins, as tasks and activities are tailored to the individual and organized accordingly. The effort will also strengthen the target group's ability to form lasting relationships and be an alternative to a daily life. 286'624.00 Denmark Oak Foundation Denmark 2018 36 months (13 Apr 2018-14 Apr 2021)
Tactical Technology Collective To provide core support to the Tactical Technology Collective to advance the skills, tools and techniques of human rights activists. Based in Berlin, it supports human rights defenders both remotely and directly to protect their privacy, safeguard their security, use information and technology more effectively for social change, and expand their digital toolboxes. 702'128.00 Germany International Human Rights Supporting and protecting human rights defenders 2017 35 months (01 Aug 2017-31 Jul 2020)
Tandrødderne To provide materials to the dental clinic Tandrødderne in Copenhagen. 188'511.00 Denmark Oak Foundation Denmark 2016 36 months (7 Mar 2016-31.03.2019)
Taskforce (Dansk Stalking Center) The main aim of the project is to give the network surrounding a family where there is domestic violence some tools to intervene as soon as they become aware of the violence. The project is for the network around a family affected by domestic violence such as neighbours, various kinds of social workers, work colleagues, janitors in building complexes, schools, parents in kindergartens - anyone who can do something to help stop the violence. 123'599.00 Denmark Oak Foundation Denmark 2018 23 months (1 May 2018-30 Apr 2020)
Tata Trusts To increase domestic climate philanthropy and support for organisations working on climate change mitigation in India. This will be achieved by establishing a climate-focused donor advisory and philanthropic coordination platform for Indian philanthropies. Tata Trusts plays a pioneering role in transforming traditional ideas of charity and introducing the concept of philanthropy to make areal difference to communities. 225'254.00 India Environment Climate Change 2018 23 months (1 Oct 2018-30 Sep 2020)
Teach For All To provide core support to Teach For All to increase and expand educational opportunities for disadvantaged students around the world. Teach For All is helping a network of partners shape a generation of global leaders to drive innovative, broad-scale, systemic change to ensure that all children have the opportunity to attain an excellent education. 850'000.00 Worldwide Learning Differences 2018 12 months (1 Oct 2018-31 Oct 2019)
Teach for America To support Teach for America to strengthen training and support of teachers in the Eastern North Carolina region. This will help meet the needs of diverse learners and build more equitable classrooms. 200'000.00 United States Learning Differences 2018 11 months (1 Apr 2018-31 Mar 2019)
Teach for America To support Teach For America to incorporate an orientation around learner variability and disability justice into its programme continuum to reach 3,500 new teachers each year. This will start with the integration of Universal Design for Learning into its national pre-service programme. Teach For America will also create an ecosystem of learning that connects its 53 regions and over 46,500 alumni to collaborate around best practices that will lead to expanded opportunities for all children, including those with learning differences. 1'500'000.00 United States Learning Differences 2017 36 months (01 Feb 2017-01 Feb 2020)
